translations.en: üå≥ Probably because of the big storm of yesterday, a tree has fallen on the small path where you are walking. His trunk does 3 meters of thickness. It's blocking you the passage.
Cut down the tree and continue

translations.en: You take an axe from your bag and cut down the tree. It took you 30 minutes to clear your way!

Vous allez dans le village le plus proche, empruntez une charrette et son attelage, revenez dans la for√™t, chargez le bois pr√©alablement d√©coup√© dans la charrette, revenez au village, et vendez le tout √† l'√©b√©niste. Vous allez dans le village le plus proche, empruntez une charrette et son attelage, revenez dans la for√™t, chargez le bois pr√©alablement d√©coup√© dans la charrette, revenez au village, et vendez le tout √† l'√©b√©niste. C'est seulement apr√®s cela que vous d√©couvrez qu'une charrette et son attelage co√ªtent plus cher que le bois r√©sultant d'un seul arbre !

translations.fr: Vous vouliez couper l'arbre, mais vous r√©alisez que vous n'avez absolument pas de quoi le faire. Vous d√©cidez alors d'escalader l'imposant ch√™ne, y arrivez sans encombre, et continuez votre route.
translations.en: You want to cut down the tree, but you realize that you don't have any tool. So you decide to climb the tree and did it without problems. You continue your road.

translations.en: You decide to climb the tree because you think that it's the faster way to do it. In a few seconds, you are in the other side, free to continue your way.

Vous vous retrouvez contraint de recommencer votre escalade. Au deuxi√®me essai vous y arrivez, mais votre main est bien endolorie !
translations.en: You climb the trunk, however you are not enough careful: you wounded yourself with the rough tree's bark and fall. You have to retry your climbing. At the second time you did it, but your hand is very painful.

En large inf√©riorit√© num√©rique, vous n'h√©sitez pas √† leur donner vos possessions afin de garder la vie sauve.
translations.en: You find that climb is a good idea so you do it. When you arrive at the other side, you note the presence of four peoples, armed and they are waiting for you. Because of your numerical inferiority, you don't hesitate to give them your possessions to live.

translations.fr: Vous pr√©f√©rez changer l√©g√®rement votre chemin. Vous escaladez donc le talus du chemin sur lequel vous √©tiez, et passez quelques m√®tres comme cela. Apr√®s avoir d√©pass√© l'arbre, vous redescendez sur le sentier, et reprenez tranquillement votre route.
translations.en: You prefer change lightly your way. You climb the embankment of the path where you were and pass some meters like. After having passed the tree, you come back down on the path and resume your way.

Vous trouvez, sur un cadavre en piteux √©tat, un bel objet et une bourse rebondie. Sachant qu'ils seront plus utiles √† vous qu'au corps, vous vous en emparez et continuez votre marche foresti√®re.
translations.en: You decide to change of path. For it, you go up to the embankment of your way and progress in the forest. You find, on a dead body, a beautiful item and a lot of money. Knowing that it will be more useful for you than the body, you take it and continue your forest hike.

translations.fr: Vous estimez qu'escalader l'arbre est trop dangereux et vous n'avez pas de quoi le couper. Par cons√©quent, vous √™tes contraints de changer d'itin√©raire. translations.en: You think that climb the tree is too much dangerous and you don't have any tool to cut down it. Consequently, you have to change of way. But because of your bad sense of direction you succeed to lose your way. You arrive to go out of the forest only in the evening.
